intro: Hapalochilus trigonocarpus, commonly known as the three-carpel hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color.
